aquarium-chiller.name: Aquarium Chiller

ideal.description: Premium chiller with temperature controller (1/4 HP)

aquarium-chiller.notes: CRITICAL for axolotls in warm climates. Prevents fatal heat stress. Size chiller based on tank volume and ambient room temperature. Most homes require chiller year-round.

aquarium-filter-canister.name: Canister Filter (High-Flow)

ideal.searchQuery: canister filter aquarium premium uv sterilizer

aquarium-filter-canister.notes: For messy aquatic animals like turtles. Provides mechanical, biological, and chemical filtration. Clean monthly, replace media as needed.

aquarium-filter-sponge.name: Sponge Filter (Low-Flow)

recommended.description: Double sponge filter + adjustable air pump

ideal.description: Premium sponge filter system + quiet air pump
ideal.searchQuery: premium sponge filter aquarium quiet pump

aquarium-filter-sponge.notes: Essential for axolotls - provides gentle filtration without strong current. Sponge provides biological filtration surface. Clean weekly by squeezing in tank water (never tap water).

air-pump.name: Air Pump (Aquarium)

ideal.searchQuery: aquarium air pump ultra quiet dual

air-pump.notes: Powers sponge filters and air stones. Choose adjustable models to control flow rate. Place above tank level or use check valve to prevent backflow.

aquarium-test-kit.name: Liquid Test Kit (Master)

minimum.description: Basic liquid test kit (ammonia, nitrite, pH)

recommended.description: Master test kit (ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, pH)

ideal.description: Master test kit + GH/KH test kit
ideal.searchQuery: api master test kit freshwater gh kh

aquarium-test-kit.notes: REQUIRED for all aquatic setups. Test weekly minimum. Ammonia and nitrite must be 0 ppm at all times. Liquid tests more accurate than test strips. Essential for cycling new tanks.

water-conditioner.name: Water Conditioner (Dechlorinator)
water-conditioner.notes: REQUIRED for all water changes. For axolotls: MUST use aloe-free conditioner - Seachem Prime or Fritz Complete only. Removes chlorine, chloramine, and heavy metals. Very concentrated - small amount treats large volumes.

aquarium-heater.name: Submersible Aquarium Heater
aquarium-heater.notes: For tropical aquatic species like red-eared sliders (75-80°F). NOT for axolotls (cold-water species). Use heater guard to prevent animal contact. Position horizontally near filter output for even heat distribution.

heater-guard.name: Heater Guard (Protective Cover)

ideal.searchQuery: aquarium heater guard metal heavy duty

heater-guard.notes: REQUIRED for turtle tanks - prevents turtles from breaking glass heaters. Also prevents burns from direct contact. Allows water flow while protecting equipment.

aquarium-lid.name: Aquarium Lid/Screen Cover

minimum.description: Basic glass lid or screen cover

recommended.description: Hinged glass lid with feeding door
recommended.searchQuery: aquarium glass lid hinged feeding door

ideal.description: Custom-fit lid with cutouts for equipment
ideal.searchQuery: aquarium glass lid custom cut equipment

aquarium-lid.notes: Prevents jumping and escape - especially important for axolotls. Glass lids reduce evaporation. Screen tops allow better air exchange. Must have cutouts or hinges for heater, filter, and feeding access.

basking-platform.name: Turtle Basking Platform/Dock
basking-platform.notes: REQUIRED for semi-aquatic turtles. Must be completely dry and easily accessible. Position below heat lamp and UVB light. Should support full body weight without tipping. Textured surface prevents slipping.

python-siphon.name: Aquarium Water Changer/Siphon

spec.length: Based on tank size and distance to sink

recommended.searchQuery: python no spill aquarium water changer

ideal.description: Python pro system with extended reach
ideal.searchQuery: python no spill aquarium water changer 50ft

python-siphon.notes: Makes water changes much easier - connects directly to faucet. No more buckets. Python system allows filling and draining. For large tanks, this is essential equipment. Remember to add dechlorinator before refilling.

air-stone.name: Air Stone/Bubbler

ideal.description: LED air stone with color changing lights

air-stone.notes: Optional for most setups if filter provides adequate surface agitation. Can add visual interest. Avoid in axolotl tanks if creates too much current.

filter-media-bio.name: Biological Filter Media

spec.type: Ceramic rings, bio balls, or sponge

recommended.searchQuery: aquarium biological filter media seachem matrix

ideal.searchQuery: aquarium biological filter media professional kit

filter-media-bio.notes: Houses beneficial bacteria that convert ammonia → nitrite → nitrate. Never replace all at once - wash in tank water only, never tap water. Essential for biological filtration in all aquatic setups.

filter-media-carbon.name: Activated Carbon Filter Media
filter-media-carbon.notes: Removes tannins, medications, and dissolved organics. Replace monthly. Remove before medicating tank. Optional but helpful for water clarity. Purigen is regenerable and more effective than carbon.

substrate-slate-tile.name: Slate Tile (Aquarium Safe)
substrate-slate-tile.notes: Safe alternative to bare-bottom for axolotls. Provides better traction than glass. Easier to clean than sand. Ensure tiles are natural/unsealed - no sealants or finishes. Rinse thoroughly before use.

substrate-fine-sand-aquatic.name: Fine Sand (Aquarium Grade)

ideal.searchQuery: estes marine sand ultra fine black

substrate-fine-sand-aquatic.notes: ONLY for axolotls 6+ inches long - still carries impaction risk. Must be ultra-fine (smaller than grains can swallow). Bare-bottom or slate tile safer options. Rinse thoroughly before adding to tank. Provides natural look and beneficial bacteria surface.
